RNAseq.bamFiles.title: Sorted BAM files generated following STAR alignment

RNAseq.flagstat.title: Samtools flagstat output which counts the number of alignments for each FLAG type. Useful as a post-alignment quality check

RNAseq.countMatrix.title: Genes x Samples count matrix. Output of read summarisation by featureCounts. Features are exons and summarisation is performed at the meta-feature level on geneids

RNAseq.fastpQcHtml.title: Quality Control (QC) report output by the Fastp program for each read/read-pair.

RNAseq.countsParsed.title: Genes x Samples count matrix with human friendly gene names

files.name: lane_effects_MDS.png
files.condition: If more than one lane per library is present
files.description: MDS plot with samples labelled according to their lanes. If samples appear to cluster by lane, then this may suggest that lane-specific batch effects are present.

files.name: techRep_MDS.png
files.condition: If more than one library per sample is present
files.description: MDS plot with samples labelled according to their libraries. Multiple libraries of the same sample should cluster together, which would reflect high technical reproducibility in the RNAseq experiment.

files.name: *MDS.png
files.description: Multi-dimensional scaling (MDS) plot showing similarities and dissimilarities between samples in an unsupervised manner.

files.name: *heatmap.png
files.description: A heatmap is created for the DE genes from the *DEG_across_samples.tsv file for each contrast. The heatmap clusters samples by similarities and reorders the genes  into blocks with similar expression patterns.

files.name: volcano.png
files.description: A scatterplot that shows statistical significance (adjusted P value) of DEGs for a  particular contrast against the log fold change.

files.name: mean-var.png
files.description: Mean-variance plot showing how the trend is removed after voom precision weights are applied to the data.

files.name: *DEG_across_samples.tsv
files.description: Expression of DEGs for a particular contrast across samples. DEGs with a Benjamini-Hochberg adjusted p-value less than 0.05 are retained.

files.name: *sorted_DEG.txt
files.description: Sorted DE genes for a particular contrast, sorted from smallest to largest log fold  change. All genes with Benjamini-Hochberg adjusted p-value less than 0.05 are retained.
